content_1: .  The North Korean veterinary authority and the World Organization for Animal Health (OIE) reported two outbreaks of H5N1 in the P'yongyang region on April 16th.  The first outbreak confirmed 46,217 bird deaths.  It is unknown at this time how many birds died at the site of the second outbreak.  Control measures being applied include screening and zoning, movement control throughout the county, and quarantine.
